page.title: 18BRIT TELECOM RELAY STATION
page.content: The British Telecom relay station GR 459996 stands at the top of the steep slopes of Arncliffe woods overlooking the village of Ingleby Arncliffe.It is one of the national network of 191 relay stations used to send telephone messages and some T.V.pictures around the country.Because this station is in a National Park area,none of the reception dishes or transmitters can be over 20 metres high and therefore 32 dishes are necessary to relay the microwave signals from Newcastle to Leeds.The station is 25 years old and we were the first visitors to be allowed in.T.V.cameras and local radio were there to record the visit as well as some journalists from local newspapers.Inside the station there is a standby generator with a 4 litre engine producing 129 bhp. This is used in the event of power failure.
